title: 105_hr1381
content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. The Fund consists of appropriated amounts and payments. The Foundation will use the Fund for operating the Institute, including salaries, mediation services, and other necessary expenses. The Revolving Fund is separate from the Trust Fund and not subject to certain program priorities. The Secretary of the Treasury will invest portions of the Fund not needed for current expenses. The Revolving Fund, administered by the Foundation, is not subject to certain program priorities. The Secretary of the Treasury will invest portions of the Fund in interest-bearing obligations of the United States. Investments can be made on original issue or by purchasing outstanding obligations at market price. Any interest or proceeds from the sale of obligations will be credited to the Revolving Fund. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow the use of the Institute by a federal agency. The Federal agency can utilize the Foundation and the Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services regarding disputes on the environment, public lands, or natural resources. Payment for services can be made through a contract with funds going into the Revolving Fund. Prior notification to the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality is required before using the Foundation or Institute, including details on the issues and parties involved. The Foundation or Institute can provide services for disputes involving Federal agencies or instrumentalities. Prior notification and concurrence from the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality are required in such cases. SEC. 8. Authorization of appropriations for the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 1998 through 2002. SEC. 9. Conforming amendments. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amendments are made to the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992, changing references from "Fund" to "Trust Fund" in various sections.
